data.title: SEREN: A SPH code for star and planet formation simulations
data.name: seren
data.description: SEREN SPH code (Hubber et al. 2011) for astrophysical hydrodynamics simulations

evidence: "SEREN ... is a self-gravitating Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) code written in Fortran 95/2003 for astrophysical hydrodynamics problems, such as star and planet formation." (domain-specific simulation code used directly for research)
The README describes SEREN as a standalone SPH code rather than a library to be imported by other software, implying it is run as an application for simulations.

The only usage/distribution information given is a link to the SEREN webpage and the repository itself, with no mention of package managers, binaries, or containers, implying distribution via the source repository.
